info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oconee County through 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles north of Walhalla, or near Oconee State Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Salem, Oconee State Park, Lake Keowee and Mountain Rest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
